H0.text: Which was the first European city this century to open an underground railway system. London

H1.text: Which was the first European city this century to open an underground railway system. Berlin

H2.text: Which was the first European city this century to open an underground railway system. Vienna

H3.text: Which was the first European city this century to open an underground railway system. Paříž

A4.text: The first line opened without ceremony on 19 July 1900, during the World's Fair (Exposition Universelle).

A5.text: The world's first underground railway, it opened in January 1863 between Paddington and Farringdon using gas-lit wooden carriages hauled by steam locomotives.

A6.text: The Metropolitan Railway opened on 10 January 1863 as the world's first underground passenger railway.
